title: Create a blog with GitHub Action and Pages
body:
## environment
-NPM v8.3.1
-Node: v16.14.0
-Angular: v13.2.5
-ng-bootstrap/ng-bootstrap: 12.0.0

* If `npm run ng add @ng-bootstrap/ng-bootstrap` fails, please do it as` npm config set lEGACY-PEER-DEPS true`.

## Operation Overview

What we did is as follows. `. Github/workflows/deploy.yml` If you look around, you will understand.

1. Run the GitHub Action at the timing of the GitHub's iSSUE created/update `Article` Collect Issue with a label

`` `python
Import Requests
Import JSON
From Pathlib IMPORT PATH

if __name__ = "__main__":
    PATH ("articles/list.json"). Unlink (Missing_ok = true)
    res = Requests.get ("https://api.github.com/repos/kemu3007/portal/issues?labels=Article")
    articles = json.loads (res.content)
    with Open ("ArticleS/List.json", "X") as f:
        f.write (json.dumps (articles))
`` `

2. Save the collected iSSUE in JSON format and set to refer to when Angular displays the article
3. Deliver the builded Angular project on GitHub Pages

I thought about using the GitHub Rest API using Octokit, but when I was playing at hand, the rate was restricted and it was troublesome, so I decided this format.

I used `Angular-Cli-GHPAGES` for the deployment. When redirection processing is performed other than `/`, it will automatically perform the transition to the target path. Please do not forget that, as it is necessary to use either `--base-href`,` -cname`.

-In the initial domain, specify BaseHref (--base-href = {repo_name})
-If you use a custom domain, specify CNAME (--cname = portal.kemu.site)


You don't have to worry too much because it will automatically issue HTTPS certificates. (If you use a custom domain, you need to create a CNAME record and turn it to {user_id}/gitHub/IO.)


It was a little bit of borrowing EC2 just for blogs and preparing backends and front -ends, so I'm going to go with this for a while.
